meaning: lazy and unenthusiastic, half-hearted; carelessly lazy
to be or become weak; to exist in a state of unpleasantness or neglect
generous giving of money or gifts
humor and lightheartedness, esp. when seriousness is expected
to give a lot of public attention and approval
clear and easy to understand (of speech, writing, etc.); able to think or express oneself clearly (of a person)
shocking, esp. in a way that causes horror or disgust
to follow a winding course (lit. or fig.); to wander without purpose
to interpret (something, such as a statement) wrongly
to make (someone) less angry or upset; to make less severe
